text: Wes Wise (November 25, 1928 â€“ December 9, 2022) was an American politician and sports journalist. He was born in Shreveport, Louisiana. He was, from 1971 to 1976, a three-term Mayor of Dallas, Texas. During his two terms as mayor of Dallas, Wise guided Dallas from under the cloud of the assassination and at the same time saved the Texas School Book Depository from imminent destruction, preserving it for further research into the president's murder.Douglass,James W. JFK and the Unspeakbale. Why he died and why it matters. Maryknoll, NY, Orbis Books, 2008, p. 295-298. Wise died on December 9, 2022, at the age of 94. ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Mayors of Dallas Category:Journalists from Texas Category:Journalists from Louisiana Category:Politicians from Shreveport, Louisiana Category:20th-century American politicians
title: Wes Wise
